title: J. D. Salinger
summary: Jerome David Salinger (/ˈsælɪndʒər/; January 1, 1919 –  January 27, 2010) was an American writer best known for his 1951 novel The Catcher in the Rye. Before its publication, Salinger published several short stories in Story magazine[1] and served in World War II. In 1948, his critically acclaimed story "A Perfect Day for Bananafish" appeared in The New Yorker, which published much of his later work.
